intro: Heracleum wolongense, commonly known as the Wolong cowparsley, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of central and southern China. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant is characterized by its tall, branched stems and large, compound leaves that can reach several feet in length. Its flowers are small and white, arranged in umbrella-like inflorescences, typical of the carrot family. Heracleum wolongense is often found in moist, shaded areas and can grow up to 3 meters in height.
